@graph.court: Supreme Court of the United States

@graph.reasoning: describes anticompetitive overbuying by power buyers
describes monopsony as the mirror image of monopoly
analytically the same as monopoly or cartel pricing
monopoly and monopsony are symmetrical distortions of competition from an economic standpoint
analytically similar between monopoly and monopsony
asymmetric treatment of monopoly and monopsony has no basis in economic analysis
predatory pricing schemes are rarely tried, and even more rarely successful
@graph.court: Supreme Court of the United States

@graph.reasoning: predatory pricing requires a firm to suffer certain losses in the short term on the chance of reaping supracompetitive profits in the future
@graph.court: Supreme Court of the United States

@graph.reasoning: actions taken in a predatory-bidding scheme are often the very essence of competition
